channel.title: How would I want to go about doing this?
channel.description:
I am adding a area on my website where users can ask me a question by using a form on one of my pages, but first I have to validate it.
The best way I can think about doing this is the following
User submits question It goes into my mysql table By default a column name valid is set to false I will have a section in my control panel where all of these posts are displayed and I can click something that will change false to true On the question and answers page it will show only posts that have validate set to true.
Any other ideas on how I would want to go about doing this[br][br][size=1]Posted on: May 21, 2009, 05:12:14 pm[/size][hr]Well im almost done now anyways so I just did it the way I wanted to.

item.title: How would I want to go about doing this?
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

[quote=“sppt, post:5, topic:279643”]Straight from the pastebin i wrote:
[php]$_SESSION[‘time’] = (isset($_SESSION[‘time’]) ? $_SESSION[‘time’] : 31);
if(((time() - $_SESSION[‘time’]) <= 30)) {
echo “You gotta wait at least “.(30-(time() - $_SESSION[‘time’])).” seconds to make another paste!”;
}[/php]
Of course, you might wanna change the time ;)[/quote]

Thanks this will keep people from spamming.

Read full topic
item.source: How would I want to go about doing this?

item.title: How would I want to go about doing this?
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

[quote=“xKadir, post:2, topic:279643”]Maybe you should display the newest questions first? (DESC)
Other then that, looks good for now? :)[/quote]

I just added capatcha verification so if any of you want to ask questions related to my website on there I will answer them and post them
